thread.title: CES 2017: Coolpad introduces the all-metal Conjr with 5-inch HD display and 3GB of RAM
thread.title_full: CES 2017: Coolpad introduces the all-metal Conjr with 5-inch HD display and 3GB of RAM

title: CES 2017: Coolpad introduces the all-metal Conjr with 5-inch HD display and 3GB of RAM
text:
January 6, 2017 “The Coolpad Conjr is a mid-range Android smartphone with a premium design” 
At CES in Las Vegas, Coolpad has added a new smartphone to its portfolio with the launch of the Conjr. It is a mid-range offering that boasts a premium metal unibody design, and a fingerprint sensor that’s located at the rear panel right below the camera. The phone also gets a front-facing LED flash to let you capture better selfies in low-light conditions. 
As far as the other specs go, the Coolpad Conjr features a 5-inch HD display with a pixel density of 294ppi. The phone is powered by a 1.0GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735CP processor, mated to Mali 450 graphics and 3GB of RAM. It comes with 16GB of internal memory, which can be further increased up to 64GB by inserting a microSD card. 
The Coolpad Conjr rocks a 13-megapixel primary snapper with LED flash, autofocus, f/2.2 aperture, and a 5P lens. For selfies and video calling, it features an 8-megapixel front shooter with an LED flash and f/2.2 aperture. In terms of connectivity, it offers 4G LTE, dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth. Software-wise, the device boots Android 6.0 Marshmallow with Cool UI 8.0 on top. A 2,500mAh battery keeps the handset alive. The Coolpad Conjr has been priced at $180, which roughly translates to Rs 12,200. Initially, the phone will be available in the US in a single Iron Grey hue. As of now, there’s no word when the device will go on sale. Facebook Comments
